features.name: Data Import & Export Tools
features.content: Ability to input, modify and extract data from the application in bulk through a structured file. This feature was mentioned in 10 Maestra reviews.

features.name: Integration APIs
features.content: Based on 10 Maestra reviews. Application Programming Interface - Specification for how the application communicates with other software.  API's typically enable integration of data, logic, objects, etc with other software applications.

features.name: Breadth of Partner Applications
features.content: To what extent are there partner applications readily available for integrating into this product?  Partner applications typically provide complementary, best of breed functionality not offered natively in this product.

features.name: Customization
features.content: System provides sufficient customization to meet business requirements This feature was mentioned in 11 Maestra reviews.

features.name: Workflow Capability
features.content: Automates a process that requires a series of steps that typically require intervention by a several different users.  Administrators can write rules to determine who and when a user needs to complete a step.  Also includes notification of users when they need to take action.

features.name: User, Role, and Access Management
features.content: As reported in 11 Maestra reviews. Grant access to select data, features, objects, etc. based on the users, user role, groups, etc.

features.name: Internationalization
features.content: Enables users to view and transact business with the same content in multiple languages and currencies.

features.name: Sandbox / Test Environments
features.content: Allows administrators to easily develop and test changes to the CRM deployment.  After changes are made admins can easily migrate the changes into the "live" or "production" environment.

features.name: Performance and Reliability
features.content: Software is consistently available (uptime) and allows users to complete tasks quickly because they are not waiting for the software to respond to an action they took.

features.name: Building and Personalizing Emails
features.content: Create and design emails with an editor; manage templates; personalize dynamically This feature was mentioned in 13 Maestra reviews.

features.name: Sending Outbound Emails
features.content: Create targeted lists, schedule and manage bulk email sending. This feature was mentioned in 11 Maestra reviews.

features.name: Manage Email Deliverability
features.content: Ensure inbox delivery. Includes opt-in management, bounce handling, unsubscribe processing, suppression lists, email preview, spam checking, link validation, and delivery monitoring. 11 reviewers of Maestra have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: Automated Email Responses
features.content: Set up automated nurturing emails based on events, online activities, and lead scores This feature was mentioned in 11 Maestra reviews.

features.name: Landing Pages and Forms
features.content: Build customized landing pages and lead capture forms for specific marketing campaigns to maximize conversion and to capture the right qualifying information.

features.name: Dynamic Content
features.content: Based on 10 Maestra reviews. Dynamically customize emails, forms, and landing pages for specific segments of customers and prospects.

features.name: A/B Testing
features.content: As reported in 12 Maestra reviews. Test alternate versions of emails, landing pages, and forms. Learn what works, maximize response rates, and increase conversion.

features.name: Mobile Optimized
features.content: Based on 10 Maestra reviews. Support mobile-optimized emails, online forms, and landing pages.

features.name: Marketing Lead Database
features.content: A marketing lead database is the system of record for your most important marketing asset: your leads and contacts. Includes a view of all marketing interactions between each prospect and your company, including website visits, email clicks, scoring changes, and data updates/history.

features.name: Data Quality Management
features.content: Data quality consists of deduplication, cleansing, and appending your marketing database. 10 reviewers of Maestra have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: Segmentation
features.content: Segment your database and build list of target leads and contacts.  Filter on demographic and company attributes (title, company size, location) as well as behavioral filters and CRM information. This feature was mentioned in 12 Maestra reviews.

features.name: Lead Scoring and Grading
features.content: Automatically qualify and score leads based on demographics as well as prospect online behaviors, including recency and frequency. Assign your own weights to determine lead scores for prioritization.

features.name: Lead Nurturing
features.content: Automate drip marketing campaigns that send relevant messages over time, based on prospect behaviors and pre-defined campaign steps.

features.name: Online Behavior Tracking
features.content: Track which emails a prospect opens and clicks, what web-pages they visit, what keywords they use, even what they say on social networks.

features.name: Automated Alerts and Tasks
features.content: Create tasks automatically and provide real-time sales alerts over email, RSS or mobile device.

features.name: CRM Lead Integration
features.content: Sync lead, contact, account, and opportunity information with your CRM system.

features.name: Program ManagementView full feature definition
features.content: Manage marketing campaigns and programs across multiple channels, including online ads, video campaigns, mobile, virtual events, and social media. Create and optimize program assets such as landing pages, emails, campaigns, and lists. Track program objectives, results, and costs to assess the program ROI.

features.name: Event / Webinar Marketing
features.content: Streamline the entire event process, including personalized invitations, registration, reminders, and post-event follow-up.  Integrate with online meeting tools like WebEx, Adobe Connect, GoToWebinar.

features.name: Social Media Engagement
features.content: Social apps including polls, sweepstakes, and referral programs can enhance audience engagement.  Include these on your website, landing pages, Facebook pages, and emails.

features.name: Social Media Advertising
features.content: Amplify brand and community stories; Reach customers by social profile and activity; Optimize social ad campaigns in real-time

features.name: Basic Reporting
features.content: As reported in 12 Maestra reviews. Access pre-built and custom reports and dashboards to measure leads by source/campaign/month, email performance, landing page performance, and web and social activity. Create report subscriptions that can automatically send updates to your team and executives.

features.name: Web Analytics
features.content: Track which pages prospects and customers visit and how often they come back.  Capture the history in database for lead scoring and sales intelligence. Use anonymous company look-up to identify anonymous visitors.  Send alerts to sales reps of which of their prospects and customers web activity.

features.name: ROI Analytics
features.content: Measure leads, prospects generated, pipeline, revenue, investment, and ROI by marketing channel or program. The result is that you can see which marketing investments are generating the greatest return and get visibility into how marketing budget should be allocated going forward.

features.name: Revenue Analytics
features.content: Analyze how leads flow through the funnel by measuring stage to stage conversion rates and velocity.  Allocate pipeline and revenue credit among all the marketing activities that have successfully touched an opportunity as it moves through the pipeline.

features.name: Data Enrichment
features.content: Uses external data sources to improve customer profiles.

features.name: Expandability
features.content: Can be updated to accept new sources and types of data.

features.name: Content Marketing
features.content: Can act as a content marketing platform.

features.name: Multiple Devices
features.content: Can engage with customers across any device with a consistent message.

features.name: Marketing Metrics
features.content: Provides analysis of marketing program ROI and efficiency.

features.name: Predictive Modeling
features.content: Predicts outcomes based on statistical models; can give insight to "what-if" scenarios.

features.name: Recommendation Engine
features.content: Uses artificial intelligence to provide suggestions based on desired outcomes.

initial_reviews.review_title: Best CRM solution I've ever tried
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Maestra?
I've been using Maestra 6 months now and it's hands down one of the best CRM solutions out there - I'd rate it a perfect 10/10.

The customer support is exceptional - always available, friendly, and patient. They go above and beyond to assist, no matter how small the question.

What sets Maestra apart is its user-friendliness. It's intuitive, with virtually no learning curve, making it a breeze to navigate. Speed is another highlight: Maestra operates at lightning-fast speeds, ensuring quick access to vital information.

Plus, it offers a wide range of analytics tools and features, making data-driven decisions a cinch.

Highly recommend it to anyone in need of a reliable CRM solution.

What do you dislike about Maestra?
I haven't encountered any downsides so far; everything works great

What problems is Maestra solving and how is that benefiting you?
Maestra has been instrumental in our marketing automation efforts. Its segmentation capabilities have allowed us to effectively reach out to our clients, reactivate dormant accounts, and run various campaigns with ease. Additionally, this CRM offers the possibility to integrate with an SMS solution, which was a crucial requirement for our company. This feature allows us to seamlessly store our client data in one centralized location, streamlining our processes and improving efficiency.

initial_reviews.review_title: Excellent customer service
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Maestra?
We're really pleased with the customer service -- we're always given prompt and helpful answers to all our questions. The team is great to work with.

Our campaign preparation & sending process has become much smoother since we implemented the platform.

What do you dislike about Maestra?
Our experience would have been even more perfect if the integration documentation was a bit more detailed, but in any case, the Maestra team is always ready to help - communication is clear and immediate.

What problems is Maestra solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our goal was to build a system that would allow us to engage with users on an ongoing basis and communicate with them at every stage of their journey -- this is exactly what Maestra helps us achieve. So far, we have launched 21 automated communication flows in total (with more to come).

Boosting customer retention was another one of our key goals. The team created a detailed customer communication roadmap with over two dozen automated campaigns, all working to increase retention metrics -- e.g., campaigns that automatically remind customers to complete their order.

The campaign prep & sending process itself has become much easier. We also have greater customization and segmentation control. In addition, we've been able to keep track of metrics better, and have seen a higher CTR and open rate.

initial_reviews.review_title: Great marketing tool & Great customer service!
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Maestra?
From a designer's point of view, it does have a great UX structure and prioritization. Most of my work is related to creating email campaigns. It didn't take much time to get to know this section, and I might say that with the help of Maestra experts, I discovered all its options in a few days. It does have lot of features to sectionize and importing placing elements. Listing and segmentation, analytical tools and reports are also great!
I have worked with 2 other email marketing software before and I must say that the flows section of this platform is one of the easiest to integration.
In terms of customer support, I must say they are fantastic. In my opinion, they are the best in my working life.

What do you dislike about Maestra?
The only suggestion I do have is it can have more ready made contents in visual editor section. Of course, the current tools meet all the essential needs.

What problems is Maestra solving and how is that benefiting you?
It does have an strong visual editor which help us to create our email campaigns in a short time.

initial_reviews.review_title: Marketing Automation Solution Review: Mindbox
initial_reviews.review_content:

Automation Workflows: Mindbox offers pre-built automation workflows that help businesses automate their marketing tasks, such as lead nurturing, abandoned cart reminders, and loyalty campaigns. This saves time and improves efficiency.

What do you dislike about Maestra?
It's always recommended for businesses to thoroughly evaluate their needs and compare different marketing automation solutions before making a decision. However, it's worth noting that different businesses may have different needs and requirements, and not all marketing automation solutions may be the best fit for everyone. Some businesses may find that Mindbox lacks certain features or doesn't integrate well with their existing systems, while others may find it to be the perfect fit for their needs

What problems is Maestra solving and how is that benefiting you?
Time-consuming manual tasks: Marketing automation helps businesses save time by automating repetitive marketing tasks such as email marketing, social media management, and lead nurturing.

initial_reviews.review_title: Our good customer service assistant
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Maestra?
The platform collects lots of different data, allowing us to use it for a wide range of tasks - from direct marketing to ad campaigns on social networks. We can see what our customers browse, search for and click on our website, as well as their activity in our retail stores. This data helps us build precise segments with very specific conditions, meaning we can send highly targeted campaigns that customers find useful and respond well to. And speaking of campaigns, the platform has lots to choose from - whether we need to create a complex communication sequence (such as after an abandoned cart or browse) or send out manual campaigns.

Mindbox is perfect for teams like us that love having numbers to work with. We make all our decisions based on the concrete facts and figures that we get from reports, removing the need for any guesswork. We use these numbers with the inbuilt A/B tests to verify our hypotheses and improve metrics like our click rate or open rate.

We also like the transparent pricing approach, as it helps us plan our budget, keep our costs predictable, and understand how much we're spending on each channel.
Finally, the support team is fantastic and saves us a lot of time. Our account manager is always there to help us with our tasks or help us analyze our results and generate new ideas.

What do you dislike about Maestra?
It was hard for us to find a CRM marketer that knows how to work with Mindbox and really understands the platform's capabilities. I had to spend some time training one of our team members and this involved quite a steep learning curve - we found that there weren't enough training materials or ways of assessing how much progress we'd made. It would be great if Mindbox could help with this in some way. I believe that it would also be useful for other companies that are in the same kind of situation as us.

This also leads me on to my next point - in order to start seeing tangible results and benefits, you'll need to get to know the platform and what it can in a lot of detail. And as I just mentioned, this can be a pretty slow process.

The pop-ups could also be improved. We've had a number of difficulties when trying to launch them, as the interface in this part of the platform is not very intuitive - it can take  a lot of time to configure the design elements.

What problems is Maestra solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our main goal with Mindbox was to increase the revenue generated by our email marketing. Over the course of a year, our email marketing revenue share has increased from 3.7% to 8.8%, and we've made a 550% ROI.

We've automated a lot of our communications, including the welcome email series, product recommendation emails, lots of abandoned browse emails (such as abandoned view and cart, to name a few), as well as many other campaigns. This saves us a lot of time and has not only reduced the workload on our team, but also generated lots more money for the business.
Also, thanks to the fact that we now have access to great reports, we can run A/B tests, analyze all our efforts and keep improving our marketing.

initial_reviews.review_title: Very responsive & efficient CRM company & team
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Maestra?
We started with Mindbox around three years ago and we selected them for a number of reasons. In the three years we've worked with them, I've found them to be an efficient, very responsive company.
Whenever we had any issues, they were always there to help. When we found ways to improve the system they listened to our feedback and implemented changes.
Their ability to show us results at the click of a button is great. The reporting systems have gotten better and better over time, and this allows us to have a quick snapshot view of every email and identify how we can improve it at each stage of the way.

What do you dislike about Maestra?
The interface was not intuitive enough and we often have to ask the support team or our account manager for help.
The reporting was not up to scratch when we first started working with the platform. However, these have significantly improved over time.

What problems is Maestra solving and how is that benefiting you?
I'd say one of the key elements for us is account management. As a startup with a lean team, it's very important to have people available to us to help us with every query we have in order to manage our business more efficiently and get our messages and communications out quickly and easily. These guys have been there throughout it all, working with us.
They also worked really strongly with us in order to allow us to be able to email multiple variations of our emails in different currencies and languages across our database on a regular basis - and it's something that's really important to us.
I'm very happy with the service we receive from Mindbox and look forward to continuing working with them in the future.

initial_reviews.review_title: The best communication and loyalty tool
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Maestra?
* A lot of tools in one box: great segmentation possibilities, pop-ups, discounts, loyalty, mass and trigger messages, personal recommendations and more. The platform's flexibility fulfils all of retention goals.
* Mindbox has very powerful API so you can automate almost everything.  Web integration is very easy and can be done with GTM.
* We are working with Mindbox for 2 years and I see that product is developing very fast. Mindbox listens to every user and roll out improvements every month.
* Our customer success manager is incredible and always ready to help.

What do you dislike about Maestra?
* Pricing can be expensive for small companies. But Mindbox is very cheap for big companies.
* Mindbox is not a regular ESP, so some basic things can be very complicated at the first glance. But when you dive into it, you will understand that complexity comes with a great flexibility.
* Sometimes interface and segmentations don't work fast. Maybe because we have a very big customer base with millions users and several hundreds of actions stored.
* ML features are quite weak yet, but Mindbox manager allowed us to test them for free :)

What problems is Maestra solving and how is that benefiting you?
* CRM marketing -- we leveled up our email and push channels.
* Product recommendations -- cross-sell and up-sell mechanics helped to raise AOV.
* Loyalty features -- scanning rate in retail grew from 7% to almost 60%.
* Promotions and popups can be launched by marketing team without developers' involvement.

initial_reviews.review_title: A Flexible Marketing Automation Tool
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Maestra?
I've been using Mindbox while working in SaaS MarTech & EdTech, and I was surprised by its flexibility: I was able to customize Mindbox for our subscription model and adopt its product architecture for our students' learning processes. As a result, we've set up lots of automated marketing flows: stand-alone triggers, welcome-funnels and bulk communications. Besides that, there is a built-in flexible system of dynamic variables.

One of the best things is that I managed to set up transactional and technical notifications via Mindbox: it let us save a lot of time for our developer teams, so all the email (and other direct) communications are concentrated within one marketing team.

Personally, I found the integration process fairly transparent and the data transfer scheme easy-to-understand:
1. API
2. On-page data tracking with SDK

So a marketing team with an average technical background would be able to maintain the technical performance of the CDP.
The CDP has an amazing customer success team: the team provides real-time support and suggestions on how to improve our customer segmentation, triggers, and solve difficult issues together with product owners. And our account managers (I've worked with 4 different managers throughout the years) are always helpful in solving business needs.

What do you dislike about Maestra?
What could be improved
1. Sometimes it's difficult to understand the UX structure of the platform, you'll need some time to explore the platform (1,5 - 2 months)
2. There's a constant need to optimize and manage data processing (need to look after it constantly)
3. Hard-core personalization system with dynamic variables (managers and support help with it tho)
4. Unfortunately, there are not enough tools to inspect user data in an aggregated form: for example, you can't build a dashboard for a breakdown of user profile fields (you can download the data through the API to use it in your own dashboards instead)

What problems is Maestra solving and how is that benefiting you?
Marketing automation, Direct-marketing personalization, advanced segmentation, marketing data-management, unites digital marketing channels (especially direct), day-to-day routine automation

all_reviews.review_title: Our good customer service assistant
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Maestra?
The platform collects lots of different data, allowing us to use it for a wide range of tasks - from direct marketing to ad campaigns on social networks. We can see what our customers browse, search for and click on our website, as well as their activity in our retail stores. This data helps us build precise segments with very specific conditions, meaning we can send highly targeted campaigns that customers find useful and respond well to. And speaking of campaigns, the platform has lots to choose from - whether we need to create a complex communication sequence (such as after an abandoned cart or browse) or send out manual campaigns.

Mindbox is perfect for teams like us that love having numbers to work with. We make all our decisions based on the concrete facts and figures that we get from reports, removing the need for any guesswork. We use these numbers with the inbuilt A/B tests to verify our hypotheses and improve metrics like our click rate or open rate.

We also like the transparent pricing approach, as it helps us plan our budget, keep our costs predictable, and understand how much we're spending on each channel.
Finally, the support team is fantastic and saves us a lot of time. Our account manager is always there to help us with our tasks or help us analyze our results and generate new ideas.

What do you dislike about Maestra?
It was hard for us to find a CRM marketer that knows how to work with Mindbox and really understands the platform's capabilities. I had to spend some time training one of our team members and this involved quite a steep learning curve - we found that there weren't enough training materials or ways of assessing how much progress we'd made. It would be great if Mindbox could help with this in some way. I believe that it would also be useful for other companies that are in the same kind of situation as us.

This also leads me on to my next point - in order to start seeing tangible results and benefits, you'll need to get to know the platform and what it can in a lot of detail. And as I just mentioned, this can be a pretty slow process.

The pop-ups could also be improved. We've had a number of difficulties when trying to launch them, as the interface in this part of the platform is not very intuitive - it can take  a lot of time to configure the design elements.

What problems is Maestra solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our main goal with Mindbox was to increase the revenue generated by our email marketing. Over the course of a year, our email marketing revenue share has increased from 3.7% to 8.8%, and we've made a 550% ROI.

We've automated a lot of our communications, including the welcome email series, product recommendation emails, lots of abandoned browse emails (such as abandoned view and cart, to name a few), as well as many other campaigns. This saves us a lot of time and has not only reduced the workload on our team, but also generated lots more money for the business.
Also, thanks to the fact that we now have access to great reports, we can run A/B tests, analyze all our efforts and keep improving our marketing.

all_reviews.review_title: Very responsive & efficient CRM company & team
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Maestra?
We started with Mindbox around three years ago and we selected them for a number of reasons. In the three years we've worked with them, I've found them to be an efficient, very responsive company.
Whenever we had any issues, they were always there to help. When we found ways to improve the system they listened to our feedback and implemented changes.
Their ability to show us results at the click of a button is great. The reporting systems have gotten better and better over time, and this allows us to have a quick snapshot view of every email and identify how we can improve it at each stage of the way.

What do you dislike about Maestra?
The interface was not intuitive enough and we often have to ask the support team or our account manager for help.
The reporting was not up to scratch when we first started working with the platform. However, these have significantly improved over time.

What problems is Maestra solving and how is that benefiting you?
I'd say one of the key elements for us is account management. As a startup with a lean team, it's very important to have people available to us to help us with every query we have in order to manage our business more efficiently and get our messages and communications out quickly and easily. These guys have been there throughout it all, working with us.
They also worked really strongly with us in order to allow us to be able to email multiple variations of our emails in different currencies and languages across our database on a regular basis - and it's something that's really important to us.
I'm very happy with the service we receive from Mindbox and look forward to continuing working with them in the future.

all_reviews.review_title: The best communication and loyalty tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Maestra?
* A lot of tools in one box: great segmentation possibilities, pop-ups, discounts, loyalty, mass and trigger messages, personal recommendations and more. The platform's flexibility fulfils all of retention goals.
* Mindbox has very powerful API so you can automate almost everything.  Web integration is very easy and can be done with GTM.
* We are working with Mindbox for 2 years and I see that product is developing very fast. Mindbox listens to every user and roll out improvements every month.
* Our customer success manager is incredible and always ready to help.

What do you dislike about Maestra?
* Pricing can be expensive for small companies. But Mindbox is very cheap for big companies.
* Mindbox is not a regular ESP, so some basic things can be very complicated at the first glance. But when you dive into it, you will understand that complexity comes with a great flexibility.
* Sometimes interface and segmentations don't work fast. Maybe because we have a very big customer base with millions users and several hundreds of actions stored.
* ML features are quite weak yet, but Mindbox manager allowed us to test them for free :)

What problems is Maestra solving and how is that benefiting you?
* CRM marketing -- we leveled up our email and push channels.
* Product recommendations -- cross-sell and up-sell mechanics helped to raise AOV.
* Loyalty features -- scanning rate in retail grew from 7% to almost 60%.
* Promotions and popups can be launched by marketing team without developers' involvement.

all_reviews.review_title: A Flexible Marketing Automation Tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Maestra?
I've been using Mindbox while working in SaaS MarTech & EdTech, and I was surprised by its flexibility: I was able to customize Mindbox for our subscription model and adopt its product architecture for our students' learning processes. As a result, we've set up lots of automated marketing flows: stand-alone triggers, welcome-funnels and bulk communications. Besides that, there is a built-in flexible system of dynamic variables.

One of the best things is that I managed to set up transactional and technical notifications via Mindbox: it let us save a lot of time for our developer teams, so all the email (and other direct) communications are concentrated within one marketing team.

Personally, I found the integration process fairly transparent and the data transfer scheme easy-to-understand:
1. API
2. On-page data tracking with SDK

So a marketing team with an average technical background would be able to maintain the technical performance of the CDP.
The CDP has an amazing customer success team: the team provides real-time support and suggestions on how to improve our customer segmentation, triggers, and solve difficult issues together with product owners. And our account managers (I've worked with 4 different managers throughout the years) are always helpful in solving business needs.

What do you dislike about Maestra?
What could be improved
1. Sometimes it's difficult to understand the UX structure of the platform, you'll need some time to explore the platform (1,5 - 2 months)
2. There's a constant need to optimize and manage data processing (need to look after it constantly)
3. Hard-core personalization system with dynamic variables (managers and support help with it tho)
4. Unfortunately, there are not enough tools to inspect user data in an aggregated form: for example, you can't build a dashboard for a breakdown of user profile fields (you can download the data through the API to use it in your own dashboards instead)

What problems is Maestra solving and how is that benefiting you?
Marketing automation, Direct-marketing personalization, advanced segmentation, marketing data-management, unites digital marketing channels (especially direct), day-to-day routine automation

review_question_answers.answer:
What could be improved
1. Sometimes it's difficult to understand the UX structure of the platform, you'll need some time to explore the platform (1,5 - 2 months)
2. There's a constant need to optimize and manage data processing (need to look after it constantly)
3. Hard-core personalization system with dynamic variables (managers and support help with it tho)
4. Unfortunately, there are not enough tools to inspect user data in an aggregated form: for example, you can't build a dashboard for a breakdown of user profile fields (you can download the data through the API to use it in your own dashboards instead)

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Maestra solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: Marketing automation, Direct-marketing personalization, advanced segmentation, marketing data-management, unites digital marketing channels (especially direct), day-to-day routine automation
